definition: to go out

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
to throw caution to the wind/to press one's luck/to go for broke
to move out (vacate)/to shift sth out
spilt water/(fig.) sth that can not be retrieved/spilt milk

sentences.english: He had cleared them out three years ago but they had all come back in again.
sentences.chinese: 祂三年前曾經把他們趕出去，但不久又回覆舊觀。

sentences.english: Give them a call and hang out sometime.
sentences.chinese: 給他們打個電話，約個時間出去逛逛吧。

sentences.english: Boys and girls go out together from an early age.
sentences.chinese: 美國的男孩和女孩從小就可以一塊出去玩。

sentences.english: I believe there is no way out of this forest.
sentences.chinese: 我相信沒有戮由以從這森林走出去。

sentences.english: I double feet hair dint, the Huo ground plays white dress Human body side, the one punch hits to go out.
sentences.chinese: 我雙腳發力，霍地彈到白衣人身邊，一拳砸出去。

sentences.english: The students and the instructor go out driving for blocks of two hours.
sentences.chinese: 指導員與學生出去練兩個小時。

sentences.english: Sneaking out may seem like a real option in the heat of anger.
sentences.chinese: 盛怒之下，偷偷溜出去看上去似乎是真正的解決之道。

sentences.english: I felt uncomfortable, and even afraid, of going out by myself.
sentences.chinese: 我很是不爽，甚至都害怕自個兒出去買東西了。

sentences.english: There were no entrances or exits, and players could only leave by hearthing out;
sentences.chinese: 既沒有入口也沒有出口，玩家只能爐石出去。

sentences.english: You ought to know better than to go out without an overcoat on such a cold day.
sentences.chinese: 你應當懂得這樣冷的天不穿大衣出去可不行。

sentences.english: I lurk at the end of the queue and persuade him to go for coffee.
sentences.chinese: 我悄悄跟在隊伍的末尾並說服了他出去喝杯咖啡。

sentences.english: They claimed that the boy strangled her before moving her body outside.
sentences.chinese: 他們稱男孩勒死了她然後將屍體拖出去。

sentences.english: And Joseph went throughout the land of Egypt.
sentences.chinese: 約瑟就出去巡行埃及地。

sentences.english: Goods of that quality will never sell.
sentences.chinese: 這樣質量的商品絕對賣不出去。

sentences.english: Bartender and a few bold people who followed him out.
sentences.chinese: 酒保和幾個大膽的人跟在他身後走了出去。

definition: to return/to go back
to return/to come back
to come in
(after a verb, indicates coming out, completion of an action, or ability to discern or detect)
to come out/to appear/to arise
to go in
outside (also pr. [wai4 mian5] for this sense)/surface/exterior/external appearance
to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married
see 過來|过来[guo4 lai2]
to come over/to manage/to handle/to be able to take care of
to return home

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)
outside/outer surface/abroad/place other than one's home
(slang) dang!/shoot!
it's not important/it's nothing/never mind/to have nothing to do/to be free/to be all right (out of danger or trouble)
to go out/to go away (on a trip etc)
to go back to one's roots/to return to one's native place/by ext. to join one's ancestors (i.e. to die)
all over the place/everywhere and all directions
